results.definition: a variety show with topical sketches and songs and dancing and comedians
practice intended to polish performance or refresh the memory
a summary at the end that repeats the substance of a longer discussion
an essay or article that gives a critical evaluation (as of a book or play)

examples: I reviewed the material before the test

results.definition: look back upon (a period of time, sequence of events); remember
examples: she reviewed her achievements with pride

results.definition: a subsequent examination of a patient for the purpose of monitoring earlier treatment

examples: She reviews books for the New York Times

results.definition: (accounting) a service (less exhaustive than an audit) that provides some assurance to interested parties as to the reliability of financial data

examples: the platoon stood ready for review

results.definition: a periodical that publishes critical essays on current affairs or literature or art
(law) a judicial reexamination of the proceedings of a court (especially by an appellate court)
